intro: Corydalis nigroapiculata, commonly known as the black-tipped corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the branches. Corydalis nigroapiculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and unique floral structure.
